condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Vulnerable and emergency-affected people have access to basic sanitation facilities

description.narrative: The current political crisis has a negative impact on the sustainability of hygiene behaviors. UNICEF and the Government continued commitment to Community Approaches to Total Sanitation Road Map implementation for scaling up achievement of open defecation free communities. 141 villages were triggered using CLTS and 77 (57%) achieved ODF, meeting the 2019 target. 69 institutions were provided with gender segregated latrines including change rooms for menstrual hygiene. 175,993 people (128% of target) and 26,215 were provided with sanitation in development and emergency contexts respectively. 444,351 people were reached with key hygiene messages including menstrual hygiene management (MHM) messaging in schools. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of people in humanitarian situation who access and use adequate sanitation and hygiene facilities
People reached with key hygiene and sanitation messages (HH water treatment, Hand washing and safe excreta disposal)
Number of men and women, girls and boys, who gained access to basic sanitation services in the reporting year only, as a result of UNICEF direct support
Number of communities certified free of open defecation in the reporting year only as a result of UNICEF direct support
